title: tokyohd
author: tokyohd
content: Floki Inu has announced the integration of Chainlink Keepers service into its token-locking protocol, FlokiFi Locker. The current innovation is a continuation of Floki Inu's commitment to improve the performance of its services and further expand its user base. With Chainlink Keepers, a decentralized service designed to manage tasks on behalf of smart contracts, the process of token locking by users through FlokiFi Locker promises to become both faster and more efficient as well as more secure.Read full details on U.Today https://u.today/shib-competitor-floki-inu-partners-with-chainlink-link-to-improve-its-protocol

comments.author: israt1@
comments.body: It would be great if they could join the chain link. This will help them expand in the market. Then the market can be trusted.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Huh is that correct?  Partnership.  I guess projects with a deep allowance on marketing and expansion can avail chainlnk oracle service.Quote from: JeffBrad12 on August 16, 2022, 06:27:39 AMI would like to call that not as a partnership but as a client.Fully correct. This is the best description for that.  A client avail a service not partnership.  When we say that,  there should be a cooperation between two parties. This one is like someone avail a netflix service and suddenly called partnership? Come on, floki inu is a shitcoin and this chainlil integ is just a way to attract more buyers.

comments.author: cryptobadshah
comments.body: You must also know if chainlink acts as a platform that provides its service and seeks users This isn't a new alliance this isn't their first partnership Floki inu integrated chainlink price feeds into the FlokiFi locker The Flokifi locker now displays actual token locking prices for different networks More crypto startups use chainlink every day Chainlink's prominence in the crypto space is bolstered through integrations into important projects protocols and platforms The company isn't ready to take on much and won't support future etereum Pow forks.
